newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: EU's Brittan says telecoms deal "essentially" done.
newsitem.headline: EU's Brittan says telecoms deal "essentially" done.

text.p: EU Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan said on Saturday that a deal being negotiated in Geneva on a global telecoms pact to liberalise the industry was "essentially" complete.
"Essentially we have a deal," Brittan told a news conference. Further discussions on Saturday between various countries in Geneva were filling in "final details and formalities."
Brittan said the pact was a "great success for the multilateral system and the WTO (World Trade Organisation)."

Washington announced at the WTO session on Friday night that it was adding restrictions on transmission of some television and audio services to its offer on the table, but other trading powers made clear they were still ready for an accord.

Negotiators have set another meeting for 2.30 p.m. in Geneva (1330GMT) on Saturday at which diplomats from all participating countries were likely to say whether they formally accepted the package now on the table and would sign a pact.
Officials in Washington said Acting Trade Representative Charlene Barshefsky would call a news conference during the day -- apparently to announce the final U.S. decision.
